intro: Harpalyce macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, showy flowers. The plant produces large, woody pods that contain several seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind and animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists and ecologists.
